00027 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00028 #include "kvi_heapobject.h"
00029 
00030 #include "kvi_window.h"
00031 #include "kvi_qstring.h"
00032 #include "kvi_kvs_variantlist.h"
00033 #include "kvi_kvs_script.h"
00034 
00035 
00036 //
00037 // This is a simple callback object useful in stuff like dialog.message(){}
00038 // You derive a class from KviKvsCallbackObject, pass the callback data (code,window and magic params)
00039 // and when the time comes ask it to execute the callback (maybe by passing some special parameters)
00040 //
00041 //
00042 
00043 class KVIRC_API KviKvsCallbackObject : public KviHeapObject
00044 {
00045 public:
00046         enum CallbackFlags {
00047                 // Execute the callback only if the target window exists
00048                 // If this flag is not used then if the target window dies
00049                 // the callback is executed in another window (the associated console, if possible, otherwise the first available console)
00050                 OnlyIfWindowExists = 1
00051         };
00052         enum CallbackStatus {
00053                 // succesfull execution
00054                 Success,
00055                 // error in command
00056                 Error,
00057                 // succesfull execution, but halt encountered
00058                 HaltEncountered,
00059                 // execution aborted since OnlyIfWindowExists was passed and the target window is dead
00060                 TargetWindowDead
00061         };
00062 public:
00063         KviKvsCallbackObject(
00064                         const QString      &szCallbackSource, // the name of this callback (should identify its source, like "dialog.message"): displayed in error messages
00065                         KviWindow         * pTargetWindow,    // the window that this callback should be triggered in (can be zero: to execute in the first available console)
00066                         const QString      &szCallbackCode,   // the callback code (may be empty!)
00067                         KviKvsVariantList * pMagicParams,     // magic parameters that should be passed to the callback (this class makes a copy of them)
00068                         unsigned int        uFlags = 0        // a combination of CallbackFlags
00069                 );
00070         virtual ~KviKvsCallbackObject();
00071 protected:
00072         KviKvsScript      * m_pScript;       // the callback script
00073         KviWindow         * m_pTargetWindow;
00074         KviWindow         * m_pTargetConsole;
00075         KviKvsVariantList * m_pMagicParams;
00076         unsigned int        m_uFlags;
00077 protected:
00078         // the parameter list is always shallow!
00079         CallbackStatus execute(KviKvsVariantList * pParams = 0,KviKvsVariant * pRetVal = 0);
00080 };
00081 
00082 
00083 
00084 #endif //!_KVI_KVS_CALLBACKOBJECT_H_
